    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  P L O T :
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  Based on the novella by Stephen King, director Bryan SingerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s follow-up to THE USUAL
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  SUSPECTS is a harrowing psychological thriller about the relationship that forms
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  between a boy and the neighbor he discovers is a Nazi war criminal. After a brief
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  lesson in history class, star pupil Todd Bowden (Brad Renfro) becomes obsessed with
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  Hitler and his followers. Through extensive research, he discovers that the infamous
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  Kurt Dussender (Sir Ian McKellen) has been hiding out, living a normal life in his own
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  neighborhood. But instead of reporting Dussender to the authorities, Todd decides to
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  use him to gain further knowledge...everything that the history books wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t tell him.
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  But who ends up using whom, and what happens when a susceptible young mind encounters true 
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  evil,leads to a surprising, taught, and unsettling suspense film.
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  Interested in the novella since he was 19, Singer worked closely with screenwriter Brandon
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  Boyce to bring this compelling story to the screen. Filled with the same touches that are
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  hallmarks of his previous films--careful editing, use of small spaces to evoke tense atmospherics,
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  terrific cinematography, and stellar acting--the film is a disturbing exploration into the
    Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  seductively dark side of human nature.
